intro: Eriodrys, commonly known as the narrow-leafed dandelion, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, lance-shaped leaves and a single, hollow stem that rises from the center. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, white seed heads, which are easily dispersed by the wind. Eriodrys is native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed soils. It is considered a hardy perennial that thrives in a variety of soil types and light conditions.
